author: Rachel Frazin
description: {beacon} Energy & Environment Energy & Environment   The Big Story  US plans to sell Venezuelan oil 'indefinitely' The U.S. will “indefinitely” sell Venezuelan oil, Energy Secretary Chris Wright said Wednesday — indicating that U.S. control will go beyond the barrels President Trump announced late Tuesday. © Greg Nash “We’re going to market the crude coming out of Venezuela:...
title: Wright says US will sell Venezuelan oil 'indefinitely'

author: Sophie Brams
description: The State Department announced on Wednesday that it has paused all U.S. assistance to the Somali government, citing an alleged incident where officials in the country destroyed a World Food Programme (WFP) warehouse and seized 76 metric tons of food aid meant for vulnerable Somalis. “The Trump Administration has a zero-tolerance policy for waste, theft,...
title: US suspends aid to Somalia's government

author: Sudiksha Kochi
description: Speaker Mike Johnson (R-La.) sent a letter to President Trump on Wednesday inviting him to deliver his State of the Union address to Congress on Feb. 24. This will be Trump's first time delivering a State of the Union address in his second term. He delivered remarks to a joint session of Congress in March...
title: Johnson invites Trump to deliver State of the Union address on Feb. 24

author: Sarah Davis
description: Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz (D) said that he has issued a "warning order" to prepare the Minnesota National Guard after a woman was fatally shot by an Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) officer in Minneapolis on Wednesday morning.  “[President] Donald Trump and his administration may not care much about Minnesota — that’s been pretty evident...
title: Walz issues warning order to Minnesota National Guard after fatal ICE shooting

author: Ellen Mitchell
description: President Trump on Wednesday said he “will not permit” defense companies to issue dividends or buy back their own stock until they invest more in military equipment production and address several other of his complaints. In a lengthy post to Truth Social, Trump said that “massive” shareholder dividends and buybacks were taking place “at the expense...
title: Trump threatens defense contractors over stock buybacks, executive pay

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: David Axelrod on Wednesday said the Trump administration’s capture of Venezuelan regime leader Nicolás Maduro was about oil and not to crack down on the transnational sale of drugs. “Now, this was about oil. and I think, you know, we‘re going to continue to see this Friday. He's meeting with the oil executives. This is...
title: Axelrod: Venezuela was about oil, not drugs

author: The Hill Staff
description: Protesters are demonstrating in Minneapolis on Wednesday after an Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) officer fatally shot a woman earlier in the day. A video shared on social media by a local reporter depicts masked agents approaching a vehicle in the middle of a street in Minneapolis. When the vehicle accelerates, an agent fires shots...
title: Watch live: Protests underway in Minneapolis after fatal ICE shooting

author: The Hill Staff
description: Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz (D) will brief reporters Wednesday afternoon after a woman was fatally shot in Minneapolis by an Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) officer. The Department of Homeland Security (DHS) confirmed the death. DHS spokesperson Tricia McLaughlin posted online that that “violent rioters” were attempting to interfere in an ICE operation. McLaughlin claimed...
title: Watch live: Tim Walz gives remarks after ICE-involved shooting in Minneapolis

author: Colin Meyn
description: The U.S. military’s seizure of a Russian-flagged oil tanker in the North Atlantic is ratcheting up tensions between Washington and Moscow as President Trump seeks to take control of Venezuela, in part through a targeted oil embargo.  The vessel, called the Bella 1, was boarded by U.S. forces in a joint operation with the United...
title: Russia-US tensions ratchet up after oil tanker seizure in North Atlantic

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: The Trump administration defended a federal Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) agent who shot and killed a Minnesota woman inside her vehicle on Wednesday. "It was an act of domestic terrorism," Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem said at a Wednesday press conference, claiming the woman "attacked" agents with her vehicle, trying to “run them over...
title: Trump officials defend federal agents after ICE shooting

author: Mike Lillis
description: Top House Democrats on Wednesday hammered the Trump administration for threatening to commandeer Greenland — by military force if necessary — saying an attack on a U.S. ally would not only undermine a decades-old trans-Atlantic alliance, but would also be illegal without explicit approval from Congress. "It's just completely unhinged, what Stephen Miller is allowed...
title: Democratic leaders bash Trump’s Greenland threat: ‘Completely unhinged’

author: Julia Manchester
description: White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt said on Wednesday that diplomacy has "always" been a top option for President Trump when asked about the controversy and tensions surrounding his desire for the U.S. to acquire Greenland.   "The president's first option, always has been diplomacy,” Leavitt told reporters at press briefing, citing Trump’s past efforts he says were meant...
title: Leavitt: Diplomacy 'always' Trump's first option on acquiring Greenland

author: Chuck Ingoglia, opinion contributor
description: A bipartisan coalition of senators has introduced the Ensuring Excellence in Mental Health Act, which would expand Certified Community Behavioral Health Clinics (CCBHCs) to provide comprehensive, 24/7 access to care for mental health and substance use, regardless of ability to pay.
title: Excellence in Mental Health Act will increase access for everyone

author: Cate Martel
description: 12:30 Report is The Hill's midday newsletter. Subscribe here. Happy Wednesday, folks! In today’s issue: 🚢 NEW THIS MORNING US seizes two oil tankers linked to Venezuela: The U.S. has seized two oil tankers as part of its crackdown against Venezuela’s energy exports. One of the tankers was flying a Russian flag and had been...
title: Trump ramps up pressure campaign on Venezuela

author: Dominick Mastrangelo
description: Lawmakers on Capitol Hill on Wednesday expressed concern about the antitrust review process under President Trump's administration and warned about the impact on consumers from a planned sale of Warner Brothers Discovery's sprawling entertainment studios to streamer Netflix. Democrats on the the House Judiciary Subcommittee on the Administrative State, Regulatory Reform, and Antitrust argued the massive...
title: Lawmakers push back on Netflix, Warner Brothers Discovery merger during streaming hearing

author: Emily Brooks
description: Speaker Mike Johnson (R-La.) downplayed the possibility of the U.S. taking military action in Greenland despite the White House saying that “utilizing” force to take over the island is being considered. “We’re not at war with Greenland," Johnson said Wednesday during a press conference. “We have no intention of being, no reason to be at...
title: Speaker Johnson downplays military action in Greenland: ‘Not a thing’

author: Tara Suter
description: The Trump administration is freezing social services funding to five Democratic states following a massive fraud scandal and investigation in Minnesota. In a press release Tuesday, the Department of Health and Human Services said that California, Colorado, Illinois, Minnesota and New York had lost access to federal funding focusing on child care and family assistance...
title: Trump administration freezes social services funding to 5 Democratic states

author: Max Rego
description: Moscow criticized the U.S. seizure of a Venezuela-linked oil tanker flying the Russian flag on Wednesday. The U.S. Coast Guard captured the Motor Tanker Bella 1, located in the North Atlantic, during a pre-dawn operation. The tanker had reportedly changed its name to the Marinera and was reflagged from a Guyanese to a Russian vessel....
title: Moscow pushes back on tanker seizure, says it had 'temporary permission' to use Russian flag

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Kai Trump, the granddaughter of President Trump, said former Vice President Harris should meet “in the middle” with the president to help address political extremism. “I think if both sides met in the middle, everyone would be so much more happier,” she said during an appearance on the “Impaulsive” podcast. On the show, Kai addressed...
title: Kai Trump: President, Harris should meet 'in the middle'

author: Sarah Davis
description: Utah is the first state to allow patients to renew medical prescriptions using artificial intelligence.  The state on Tuesday announced its partnership with the AI health company Doctronic. Through this program, patients in Utah can consult the service’s “AI doctor” to complete routine prescription refills.  The Utah Department of Commerce’s Office of Artificial Intelligence Policy...
title: Utah becomes first state to allow AI to approve prescription refills

author: Juliette Johnson
description: Community members learned that a large chunk of the money raised didn't go to the victims. Instead, it went to 29 different non-profits.
title: Money for mass shooting victims directed to Somali-linked nonprofits

author: Paul Bledsoe, opinion contributor
description: Voters angry about Trump’s “pain at the plug” policies are already punishing Republicans.
title: Electricity costs are rising rapidly — there is a solution, but Trump keeps blocking it

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: George Conway, the pundit and Trump critic now running as a Democrat for Congress, on Wednesday criticized the new administration, saying it is being run like a “mob operation.” “You would have thought that January 6 would have been the height of his criminality, but it's worse now he is running the United States government...
title: George Conway: Trump 'running the United States government like a mob operation’

author: Sarah Davis
description: Aldrich Ames, the CIA agent who sold American secrets to the Soviets, has died at the age of 84.  The former case officer died in custody on Monday, according to the Federal Bureau of Prisons inmate database. He had been serving out a life sentence without parole in a Maryland prison since 1994 after he...
title: Aldrich Ames, CIA agent who sold secrets to the Soviets, dies in prison

author: Julia Manchester
description: President Trump touted US support for the North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) on Wednesday amid concerns from member countries over his administration’s ambitions to acquire Greenland.   “We will always be there for NATO, even if they won’t be there for us. The only Nation that China and Russia fear and respect is the DJT REBUILT U.S.A.,” Trump said in a TruthSocial post.   In the...
title: Trump touts US support for NATO amid ambitions to acquire Greenland

author: Dominick Mastrangelo
description: President Trump is urging NFL franchises to consider hiring John Harbaugh, the longtime coach of the Baltimore Ravens who parted ways with the team after it missed the playoffs this year. "HIRE JOHN HARBAUGH, FAST. HE, AND HIS BROTHER, ARE TOTAL WINNERS!!!" Trump wrote on his Truth Social platform Wednesday. Harbaugh, who won a Super...
title: Trump urges NFL teams to hire John Harbaugh 'fast'

author: Julia Shapero
description: The center-left think tank Third Way is urging Democrats to make data privacy a priority amid a separate effort by Republicans to develop legislation focused on the issue.  In a memo released Wednesday, the non-profit argued that creating a federal privacy standard should be a top priority for both parties, warning Democrats that they “risk missing a critical opportunity to...
title: Third Way urges Democrats to prioritize data privacy amid separate GOP push

author: The Hill Staff
description: House Democratic leaders will speak with reporters Wednesday morning as lawmakers push back on President Trump‘s recent moves in Venezuela. Following the ouster of Venezuelan leader Nicolás Maduro, Trump has upped his threats on other countries — including Cuba and Colombia — and revived his push to acquire Greenland. Democratic lawmakers, including House Minority Leader...
title: Watch live: House Democrats give remarks in wake of Trump-Venezuela moves

author: The Hill Staff
description: Speaker Mike Johnson (R-La.) and Republican leaders will brief reporters Wednesday morning as they dive into their 2026 legislative agenda following the holiday recess. The press conference comes as lawmakers prepare for another briefing on the Venezuelan military operation from over the weekend, which resulted in the arrest and ouster of the South American nation‘s...
title: Watch live: House Republicans give remarks amid Venezuela, health care turmoil

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Private employers added 41,000 jobs in December, recovering from losses in the previous month but missing the projected estimate for gains by a few thousand. The Dow Jones estimated the private sector would add around 48,000 jobs in the last month of the year after losing 29,000 workers in November. Gains made were coupled with...
title: Private employers add 41,000 jobs in December, missing estimate

author: The Hill Staff
description: Days after a daring military operation to seize its leader, President Trump's gambit for Venezuela's massive oil reserves is coming into focus. That, and the future of Venezuela, are raising questions on Capitol Hill. Trump plans to meet later this week with American oil executives, a senior White House official confirmed to NewsNation, as he...
title: Live updates: Trump focuses on Venezuela's oil; officials set to brief Congress on Maduro operation

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: The Department of Justice (DOJ) said late Monday that the Brown University and MIT shooting suspect planned the attack for years, and left videos that were recovered after his body was found.  Claudio Neves Valente, a Portuguese national who formerly took courses at Brown, said in the recordings that he planned these attacks for at...
title: Brown, MIT shooting suspect planned attack for years: DOJ

author: Arturo McFields, opinion contributor
description: The United States is recovering its position, power and presence in the international arena.
title: Maduro’s capture is an embarrassing defeat for China, Russia and Iran

author: Steff Danielle Thomas
description: Officials in Denmark and Greenland are requesting a meeting with Secretary of State Marco Rubio after President Trump renewed his focus on acquiring the Arctic island, days after ousting Venezuelan leader Nicolás Maduro. The White House on Tuesday reiterated Trump's call for the U.S. to take over the Danish territory for national security reasons and...
title: Denmark, Greenland seek Rubio meeting after Trump remarks

author: Daniel Allott, opinion contributor
description: An explosion tore through a mosque in the Syrian city of Homs Dec. 26, killing and wounding worshippers in a neighborhood associated with the country’s Alawite Muslim community. Syrian authorities said an investigation was underway; a little-known terrorist group later claimed responsibility. Whatever the final attribution, the attack was a reminder of a basic reality in post-Assad...
title: Western assumptions about  Syria's new leader are being tested

author: Jared Gans
description: Trump's calls are taking on a new level of seriousness after the Venezuela operation.
title: Trump escalates aggressive posture on Greenland

author: Michaela Bourgeois
description: The pilot who landed the Boeing 737 MAX-9 aircraft that lost its door plug soon after takeoff is suing the aircraft manufacturer.
title: Alaska Airlines pilot sues Boeing for $10 million, claims he was blamed for door-plug blowout

author: Tara Suter
description: House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries (D-N.Y.) said Tuesday that he is taking President Trump’s threats about taking over Greenland “seriously.” “Everything the President says at this point we have to take seriously because he is uncommitted to the rule of law, uncommitted to the Constitution and uncommitted to doing anything that actually makes life better...
title: Jeffries is taking Trump's threats against Greenland ‘seriously’

author: Sarah Guernelli
description: Authorities found several videos recorded by Claudio Manuel Neves Valente around the time of the shootings.
title: Brown gunman cited grudge, expressed no remorse in videos, transcripts reveal

author: Brandon Conradis
description: Democrat Mike Jones on Tuesday glided to victory in the special election for a Richmond-area seat in Virginia's state Senate, according to a projection from Decision Desk HQ. Jones defeated Republican John Thomas in the race to replace Ghazala Hashmi, who was elected Virginia's lieutenant governor in November. Democrats were expected to carry the district,...
title: Democrat wins Virginia state Senate special election

author: Cameron Kiszla
description: The younger Reagan was the adopted son of Ronald Reagan and his first wife, Jane Wyman.
title: Michael Reagan, son of late president, dies in LA

author: Tara Suter
description: President Trump said late Tuesday that Venezuela is going to turn over 30 million to 50 million barrels of oil to the U.S., an announcement that follows the recent operation in which U.S. military forces captured Venezuelan leader Nicolás Maduro. “I am pleased to announce that the Interim Authorities in Venezuela will be turning over...
title: Trump: Venezuela to turn over 30-50M barrels of oil to US

author: Tara Suter
description: Michael Reagan, the eldest son of former President Reagan, has died at the age of 80, according to the Ronald Reagan Presidential Foundation and Institute. “The Ronald Reagan Presidential Foundation and Institute mourns the passing of Michael Reagan, the eldest son of President Ronald Reagan and Jane Wyman, and a steadfast guardian of his father’s...
title: Michael Reagan, eldest son of Ronald Reagan, dies at 80

author: Ryan Mancini
description: Sen. Rick Scott (R-Fla.) on Tuesday said he backs Nobel Peace Prize winner María Corina Machado as Venezuela's new leader after President Nicolás Maduro was ousted from power following a U.S. operation Saturday. "María Corina Machado is a fighter, she is loved by Venezuelans in Venezuela, and in America, and in Chile, and in Colombia,...
title: Rick Scott backs Machado for president of Venezuela
